intro: Lissochilus ephippium, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
